name: Grounds for separation
text:
PART IV.  SEPARATION

     The family court may decree a separation from bed and board for a period not to exceed two years in any matrimonial action upon a petition for separation when the court finds the marriage is temporarily disrupted. [CC 1859, §1336; am L 1903, c 22, §10; RL 1925, §2987; RL 1935, §4484; am L Sp 1941, c 93, §1; RL 1945, §12235; RL 1955, §324-60; HRS ; am L 1973, c 211, §5(s); am L 1976, c 140, §2]
Case Notes
Decisions under prior law. 
  Failure to provide.  5 H. 260.  "Cruelty" defined and held not proved.  5 H. 260.  Separation, granted and mother being unfit custody of children awarded to father.  8 H. 406.  Libellee cannot have separation on answer and cross-bill to libellant's libel for divorce.  9 H. 350.  "Divorce" defined.  25 H. 638.  A separation as contemplated by this section is a divorce in the sense the term is used in §580-4.  25 H. 638; 26 H. 132. 
  Court not authorized to decree a separation in favor of libellee on libellant's libel for divorce.  9 H. 350. 
  Fixing period of separation; effect of separation upon parties.  42 H. 279. 
  See 38 H. 394. 
  Cited:  5 H. 300, 302; 26 H. 128; 29 H. 464, 467.
